Table of Contents

Enum FeedUpdateFrequency

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Enums
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Defines the refresh interval options for automatic background polling of RSS/Atom feeds.

public enum FeedUpdateFrequency

Fields

Daily = 1440

Attempt refresh approximately once per day (every 1440 minutes).

Minimal polling frequency. Best for archival feeds, podcasts, or extremely low-activity sources.

Every12Hours = 720

Attempt refresh approximately every 12 hours.

Very conservative polling. Ideal for low-update-frequency sources or strict power-saving scenarios.

Every15Minutes = 15

Attempt refresh approximately every 15 minutes.

High-frequency option. Suitable only for critical real-time feeds. May trigger rate limits or increased battery/data usage.

Every30Minutes = 30

Attempt refresh approximately every 30 minutes.

Balanced option for feeds that update several times per day (news, blogs with frequent posts).

Every3Hours = 180

Attempt refresh approximately every 3 hours.

Recommended for most users and moderately active feeds. Significantly reduces background activity.

Every6Hours = 360

Attempt refresh approximately every 6 hours.

Suitable for feeds that update infrequently (daily digests, weekly publications).

EveryHour = 60

Attempt refresh approximately every 60 minutes (hourly).

Common default for general news and blog feeds. Good balance between freshness and resource consumption.

Manual = 0

No automatic polling is performed. Updates occur only when manually triggered by the user.

Behavior:

  • Feed is excluded from all background refresh schedules.
  • Conserves maximum resources (battery, data, network).
  • Useful for rarely updated feeds, metered connections, or power-saving mode.

Remarks

This enumeration controls how frequently the system attempts to fetch new content from each subscribed feed when automatic updates are enabled (i.e., the feed is not in Paused, Error, or Invalid state).

Key behaviors and system impacts:

  • Determines the minimum time (in minutes) between two consecutive refresh attempts for a feed.
  • Directly affects battery usage, data consumption, server load, and perceived freshness of content.
  • Used by the background scheduler/refresh queue to calculate next poll time.
  • Can be overridden per-feed or globally via user settings.
  • More frequent intervals (15–60 min) are suitable for news-heavy or real-time feeds; longer intervals reduce resource usage.

Business rules and recommendations:

  • Manual disables all automatic polling — refreshes occur only when the user explicitly triggers them.
  • Values represent minutes between refreshes (except Manual which is a special case).
  • The actual polling time may be slightly delayed due to device sleep, network conditions, or queue prioritization.
  • Very frequent polling (Every15Minutes) should be discouraged or limited to a small number of feeds to avoid rate-limiting by feed hosts and excessive battery drain.
  • Default recommendation for most users: EveryHour or Every3Hours balances freshness and efficiency.
  • Feeds in Warning or Error states may have their effective frequency temporarily reduced regardless of this setting.
